dc_description_s: Relief shown by hachures. Courses of overflows from the Indus, Chenab, and Sutlej rivers in the year 1871 and of the Hukra or Wahund are shown. Map shows: Line of ancient irrigating channel called Trewana ; apparent continuation of the Trewana to a point near Roopur ; line which may probably be found suitable for feeding Hukrah from the Sutlej ; canal of Mirza Kundee, and other proposed canals ; railway constructing. Roads and railways are shown. Boundaries of Bahawalpur, Bikaner, and Sirsa are shown. From: Journal of the Royal Geographical Society of London. Vol. 42 (1872), pp. 390-408; held in Firestone Library. Call number: G7 .J687
dc_publisher_s: London : published for the Journal of the Royal Geographical Society, by J. Murray, Albemarle Street, 1872.
dc_title_s: Map of the Bhawulpore State (Punjab) to accompany the paper by J. W. Barns, Esqre. F.G.S.
